definition: starving people
to be hungry/hungry/to starve (sb)
die of starvation
starved corpses fill the roads (idiom); state of famine

sentences.english: This vast territory of the Big Island made thousands of miles, everywhere hungry die of hunger.
sentences.chinese: 把这个地域辽阔的大岛弄得赤地千里，饿殍遍地。

sentences.english: Where hunger is ugly, where souls are forgotten.
sentences.chinese: 那里饿殍遍野，灵魂早被遗忘。

definition: starving people everywhere (idiom); a state of famine
hunger cries and cold roars (idiom); wretched poverty
starving people
starved corpses fill the roads (idiom); state of famine
to lie in total disorder/lying fallen over one another
natural disaster/famine
destitute and homeless (idiom); forced from one's home and wandering about/displaced
lit. food not filling the stomach (idiom)/fig. poverty-stricken
the people's livelihood is reduced to destitution (idiom); a time of famine and impoverishment
corpses strew the field/deadly (conflict)
lit. clothes not covering the body (idiom)/fig. poverty-stricken
wretched sight

refugee
beset by hunger and cold (idiom)/starving and freezing/in desperate poverty
